storyInfo: The Durins are celebrating an extra-long summer thanks to the damage done to their dome. Stitch tells the climate representative, come to ask him to repair the dome, that he's found some new helpers.

attributes.content: No need to be shy, Tomimi. It looks great on you.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: R-Really?
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Ehehe, I loved this swimsuit the moment I laid eyes on it. It's exactly my style!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: The tailors here sure are something. They managed to custom-make something to fit your figure so quickly.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: I-is there something wrong with my figure? I've been working out a lot harder!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Don't worry. You look super cute.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Phew, that's good then. I don't want people making fun of my tail getting thicker again... Inam, you're not going to pick out a swimsuit?
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: I'm good. I'm more interested in the buckethead that was helping out the tailor just now.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Durin technology...
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: That's some crazy good stuff!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I've never had liquor this good before!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Cheers, brother! Let's drink to your health!
attributes.name: Tipsy Durin

attributes.content: A toast to our health! Long live Old Karl Mead!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Hey, Tomimi, about that Elysium guy... Is he actually reliable?
attributes.name: Inam
Tomimi
attributes.content: Eh? He's there for us, when the chips are down...

attributes.name: Tomimi
attributes.content: Usually!
attributes.joined: Eh? He's there for us, when the chips are down...Usually!

attributes.content: Now that you mention it, there are Durin operators at Rhodes Island, but they seem to never talk about where they came from.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Do you think the Durins might be hiding something?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: No, I think they just don't care a whole lot. They always seem a lot more concerned about what's on the menu in the canteen.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: I never thought we'd get the opportunity to explore an underground Durin city.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Yeah. This might be a great opportunity to spread Gavial's name to the Durin people as well...
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: You didn't drag Gavial, Zumama, and Kemar with you on vacation this time?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Kemar said she wanted to practice boxing with Blaze. Gavial and Zumama went on a mission and haven't come back yet.
attributes.name: Tomimi
Tomimi
attributes.content: Gavial's been working way too hard recently, and that worries me!

attributes.name: Tomimi
attributes.content: I really wish she wouldn't push herself so much...
attributes.joined: Gavial's been working way too hard recently, and that worries me!I really wish she wouldn't push herself so much...

attributes.content: I wrote them a letter before I left, telling what you learned from Mr. Stitch, as well as what he told us.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: They could've taken the opportunity to go back to Acahualla for a break...
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: The three of you went and made me Great Chief without a second thought, and it's about time you all came back to see what I've gotten done.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: By the way, while you were at Rhodes Island, did anybody find this Elysium guy a little annoying?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Waheeeey, it's a completely different experience!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: You, tall guy, I saw you hanging out with those mead boys just now. Listen up, that stuff's for kids!
attributes.name: Piss-Drunk Durin

attributes.content: If you want the REAL good booze, turn your eyes toward our No. 7 Whiskey. Here, cheers.
attributes.name: Piss-Drunk Durin

attributes.content: Cheers!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: This aroma... it's like the rainforest after a thunderstorm, the smell of moss in an underground cave!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Oh. Sorry, that's just the wood cup getting a little moldy.
attributes.name: Piss-Drunk Durin

attributes.content: He seems to be enjoying himself.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Oh, Inam, you still haven't told me about how you met Mr. Stitch.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Hm... It's a bit of a long story.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Great Chief, the big things you brought with you last time were really stimulating! Just standing in front of them kept me up for days!
attributes.name: Excited Archosauria

attributes.content: My wife's been nagging me day in and day out about how these things are gonna snatch away my soul or something!
attributes.name: Excited Archosauria

attributes.content: We're talking about those heaps of junk from Columbia, right? Are those metal choppers that big of a deal?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: You bet they are! A legendary construction device, those things are, a machine of machines! Have you ever felt the joy of watching those things work right in front of you? My heart's never pounded so hard, not even when I first met my wife!
attributes.name: Excited Archosauria

attributes.content: Huh... Guess I'll have someone stop by to put shock absorbers on your chopper one of these days.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Tomimi's going to be back in a few days, so we've got to get ready to pick her up.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Picking up Tomimi? I can imagine how much work that's going to take.
attributes.name: No Longer Excited Archosauria

attributes.content: It's probably about as bad as getting beaten up by a metal chopper.
attributes.name: Groaning Archosauria

attributes.content: Who knows how many trinkets and doodads she'll bring back with her? Do you remember how many men we needed to grab all her stuff last time?
attributes.name: No Longer Excited Archosauria

attributes.content: At first, I thought it was a whole caravan!
attributes.name: No Longer Excited Archosauria

attributes.content: Tomimi's always been like that, ever since she was little. Always hoarding whatever junk she gets her hands on...
attributes.name: Groaning Archosauria

attributes.content: Don't you think it's gotten worse since she went to Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Groaning Archosauria

attributes.content: I have no idea why she had to lug back that plate of sheet metal. The one Gavial put a hole through.
attributes.name: No Longer Excited Archosauria

attributes.content: I heard she couldn't find a place to put it in her place at Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Groaning Archosauria

attributes.content: Wait, who's that up ahead?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Call me mad, signing up for this kind of abuse. First it was those topsy-turvy caves, now it's this godforsaken place.
But that old man Eartheart drives me up the wall. Just clogs up the doorway and nags you all day... Gah, damn these stupid vines! And that accursed sunlight!
I've always said artificial lighting is much better than this crap!
I'm so thirsty... And tired.
I can't fathom why the Master would leave Zeruertza. Is he a masochist or something?
A little kid?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Who are you calling a kid? You're the kid!
attributes.name: A little kid?

attributes.content: Huh, you've got a pretty funny accent. Who taught you?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: I taught myself. Got a problem with that?
attributes.name: A little kid?

attributes.content: Kids ought to mind their manners and be patient with strangers.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: What a funny-looking fella. Kind of familiar, though, anyone like this been around Acahualla? Did someone's kid go missing?
attributes.name: Archosauria

attributes.content: Not a thick-tail, or a thin-tail...
attributes.name: Archosauria

attributes.content: Not a Liberi, or a Phidia either. Wait, hold on, could you be...?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: A Durin?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: What's a Durin? Can you eat it?
attributes.name: Archosauria

attributes.content: I've only read about them in magazines, but apparently Durins are a mysterious race of people who live underground.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: You mean a metal crab?
attributes.name: Archosauria

attributes.content: No, you're the metal crab! Wanna fight?!
attributes.name: Maybe a Metal Crab?

attributes.content: Oh, I remember now! There was an article in 'Stranger Things' a few years ago about how the Durins were really good at making alcohol! That's something metal crabs can't do.
attributes.name: Archosauria

attributes.content: At best, metal crabs might get drunk off of eating fermented fruits.
attributes.name: Archosauria

attributes.content: They also don't live underground. They just cover themselves with dirt.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: That's not what matters!
attributes.name: Not a Metal Crab

attributes.content: *sigh*... I knew it. You surface-dwellers are just a bunch of short-sighted egomaniacs who keep running their mouths despite not knowing anything.
attributes.name: Not a Metal Crab

attributes.content: You people even make Durins look smart.
attributes.name: Not a Metal Crab

attributes.content: Gah, beyond all that though, your aesthetic sensibilities are compelte trash.
attributes.name: Not a Metal Crab

attributes.content: Hey, little Durin, I'll have you know— I'm wearing Sargon's chicest styles.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: If that's your idea of 'chic,' then it's all the proof I need that everyone up here has trash taste. What is the point in going along with aesthetic merit determined by someone else? You might as well be a lowly pleb.
attributes.name: Pint-Sized Durin

attributes.content: Great Chief, I think this kid might have a few screws loose. Need me to fix him up?
attributes.name: Archosauria

attributes.content: He's still got a long life ahead of him. Let him be.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: I matured a long time ago, thank you very much!
attributes.name: Pint-Sized Durin

attributes.content: Ugh... Why am I even wasting time talking to these ignoramuses? Farewell.
attributes.name: Mature Durin

attributes.content: Oh. There he goes.
attributes.name: Archosauria

attributes.content: Hmm? He stopped again?
attributes.name: Archosauria

attributes.content: Uhh...
attributes.name: Mature Durin

attributes.content: Ahem... Uhh, if I may ask a small favor, surface-dwellers...
attributes.name: Mature Durin

attributes.content: Can I have some water?
attributes.name: Mature Durin

attributes.content: So, the rest is pretty much what you wrote in the letter? He said that a Durin city is in trouble and needs our help?
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: At least, that's what Stitch said at the time.
attributes.name: Inam
Elysium
attributes.content: Take a good look around us! How could this beautiful city possibly...?

attributes.name: Elysium
attributes.content: *hic*! How could there possibly be any trouble?
attributes.joined: Take a good look around us! How could this beautiful city possibly...?*hic*! How could there possibly be any trouble?

attributes.content: Well, uhh, the drinks here being way too good can be troublesome. Might end up under the table if you're not careful, but that would NEVER happen to me. Cheers!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: This is probably that unsociable little rascal's roundabout way of inviting us to see his beautiful home, and I can totally understand that sentiment.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Not everyone's brain is fried like yours, Elysium.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Stitch stayed with us for a month, and one day, he was pestering a group of Archosauria building a train.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: He said, uh, 'You folks are good enough! These bits of iron and copper you've soldered together might be able to help me! Want to come down to Zeruertza to have a look?'
attributes.name: Inam
Elysium
attributes.content: So then you–– Brother, mind topping me off? I'll finish yours––

attributes.name: Elysium
attributes.content: So, you went along with it?
attributes.joined: So then you–– Brother, mind topping me off? I'll finish yours––So, you went along with it?

attributes.content: Though Stitch was definitely exaggerating the scope of the crisis, I... was actually curious to see if there's any business to be done with our underground neighbors.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Good idea!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: If Acahualla ever wants to escape its savage, brutish state, it'll need every opportunity it can get. I heard the Durins are exceptional at smelting and smithing. If we could do them a favor, we might be able to get a thing or two in return...
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: You folks won't have to get all excited over a few bits of scrap metal anymore.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Inam... I didn't expect you to be such an upstanding Great Chief! I thought you'd just blow all your money in the city every day.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: You brat. Is that how you think of me?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: If Acahualla wants to develop, the most important thing it needs is money. Doesn't matter if it's Sargonian coins, Columbian bills, or Victorian pounds. We need them all.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: But with Acahualla's current manufacturing output – some shoddy handmade products, a bit of unrefined ore, we barely have enough money for people to live decently, let alone think about getting rich.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Luckily, you don't have to worry about how the city defines 'living decently.'
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: That said, there's a difference between money and wealth. Sitting on a stack of money doesn't accomplish anything, but once you get it into circulation, then it becomes 'wealth.'
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Acahualla is already on the up and up. But to become even better, it needs opportunity.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: For example, a technological partnership with the Durins.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Hmm, this is a bit beyond me... All I know is, whenever I run into a problem, I throw some Arts at it! If that doesn't work, I can always whack it with my staff!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: That's the 'Gavial's Will' way of life!
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: Hahaha! Even after working with Rhodes Island for so long, you still can't leave your roots behind, huh?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: But, uhh, the best that I can do is some tinkering around the edges. For Acahualla to truly develop, we still need a 'leader.'
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: But Inam, aren't you already the Great Chief?
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: A leader is someone who can truly unite the Tiacauh. Am I gonna do that? A little too troublesome for me.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: I'd rather go shopping in the city.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: I like the way you think! I'm quite fond of shopping myself, but nothing beats the great outdoors, *hic*!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: By the way, I haven't seen our little motor-mouthed friend for quite some time. Did he sneak off somewhere?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Seems like it...
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: I'd assume he went to set something up?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Oh, right, but since we're right in front of the big water slide... It wouldn't hurt to enjoy our vacation first, right?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: I, I think the Yanese Operators at Rhodes Island have a saying for this! It goes something like... uhh, 'the host plans, and the guests follow'?
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: I think that means... Since the host isn't here, we can do whatever we want.
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: *hic*! Well said! I'll drink again to that pearl of wisdom!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Race you to the foot of the slide, my friends!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Elysium really is getting used to the Durin lifestyle a bit too quickly...
attributes.name: Tomimi

attributes.content: *pant* *pant*... Finally shook off that rabble of drunkards.
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: That's why I can't stand these soulless Durins! What are these idiots wasting their precious lives on?!
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: I've only been away for a month, and Zeruertza's already turned into a terrible eyesore. Dammit! I never should've come back!
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: And as for those stupid surface-dwellers... Gah, as long as they can build me a railway bridge that won't collapse, I suppose I can compromise my standards a bit more.
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Stitch? You really came back to us! Word was going around about a teetotaler Durin wandering Zeruertza. I knew it had to be you!
attributes.name: Elderly Durin

attributes.content: Edge Eartheart... You're never going to leave me alone, are you?
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Where have you been all this time? I was running all over looking for you. I wore out my old bones searching around that cave-in!
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Your old bones are harder than rock. I, on the other hand, nearly died.
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Don't tell me, you... went to the surface?!
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: What, you got a problem?
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: I can't believe you did that, Stitch.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: You, you're too gutsy for your own good. I never imagined you'd...
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: Actually manage to do something useful! Hurry, let me see what fancy goodies you brought back!
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: The network of caves above the lift is way too hard to navigate, and I have no clue where my map went. Nobody's been up there in years!
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: You remembered to bring me a souvenir, right? Or maybe some exotic ore specimens? Some fermentable surface plants? The latest issue of 'Stranger Things'?! The ones they have at the library are all out-of-date.
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: No, uhh, how should I put this...?
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: I brought a few people back.
attributes.name: Stitch Canvas

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Edge Eartheart

attributes.content: 'Thus, she decided...'
attributes.name: Contemplative Lupo

attributes.content: 'She decided on Old Karl Mead!'
attributes.name: Contemplative Lupo

attributes.content: Ugh, that's not good enough. Maybe the product placement should come a bit earlier? Let me revise that a bit...
attributes.name: Contemplative Lupo

attributes.content: 'Cheaper than cheap. Crazier than crazy!'
attributes.name: Contemplative Lupo

attributes.content: 'If you need a place to cut loose, have a great time, and, of course, enjoy a sip of some soul-soothing mead—'
attributes.name: Contemplative Lupo

attributes.content: 'Look no further than Zeruertza and our famed Old Karl Mead!'
attributes.name: Contemplative Lupo

attributes.content: Good. Concise, straightforward, and lavish in praise. The client should be satisfied with this. Hopefully.
attributes.name: Contemplative Lupo
